result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn A Bucksa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail to be applied to cost.  Balance to be paid as a Conditon of Probation.

Continue with AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Standard Release Conditions-STAYED to be used at Agent's Discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn A Bucksa

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
from Lake country Wellness & Counseling

Defendant Shawn A Bucksa in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld
- 18 months Probation. 
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation- Cash Bail on file to be applied
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation- Cash Bail on file to be applied
- Conditions of Probation: Continue with AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.


CONDITION TIME: 90 DAYS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED to be used at Agent's Discretion. 

- Court grants expunction upon written request of the defendant and upon successful completion of Probation, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Sentencing hearing on November 3, 2014 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shawn A Bucksa in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.
